headline: Mushroom Chicken Piccata
description: Chicken sauteed in white wine, lemon and butter gets a boost from mushrooms in this rendition of a classic.

video.description: Mushrooms take classic chicken piccata to new heights of flavor.
video.name: Mushroom Chicken Piccata

name: Mushroom Chicken Piccata
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together flour, salt and paprika. In a separate dish or bowl, mix together egg and milk. Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture, then in seasoned flour.
In a large skillet, heat butter or margarine over medium-high heat. Saute chicken pieces until golden brown. Add mushrooms and onion and saute for 3 to 5 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine the broth, wine, lemon juice and cornstarch. Mix together and pour mixture over chicken and mushrooms. Reduce heat to medium low and let chicken mixture simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

review.reviewBody: I'm rating this a 5-star based on modifications I made to the recipe which were based on other reviews/mods I read. I used 2 large boneless breasts, sliced long ways in 6 total pieces and flattened with a meat tenderizer. I had to increase the flour to 3/4 cup and the salt and paprika proportionately. I added olive oil to the butter, probably about 1/8-1/4 cup. Fried the chicken as instructed and then pulled the breasts out of pan and added the 'rooms and onions to pan along with 2 heaping tablespoons of minced garlic. Then placed the breasts back on top of the veggies. Covered and let it cook for 10 minutes. I didn't have any white wine and used 2 Cups of chicken broth to compensate. I also increased the lemon juice to 5-6 tablespoons and added about 4 tablespoons of rinsed capers and 4 tablespoons of chopped cilantro. Covered again and let cook for 15 minutes - removed cover for remainder of 5-10 minutes to thicken. Served over Sabzi Polo (PERSIAN rice with greens). EXCELLENT
Easy and delicious!
My 1st attempt and it turned out really well. Will definitely make this again. It's very easy to make, yet very tasty. Well worth a try.
Didn't really do much for me. I typically LOVE Chicken Piccata recipes, but this one wasn't as flavorful as I expected.

Wow Love this recipe! Will definitely make this over and over! Thank you for such a great recipe!!!! 2nd time I made this I added garlic, plain artichoke hearts and capers to the sauce and it was amazing!!!!! Wow one of my families faves!!

Good recipe. Easy to follow with good results. I added ground salt and pepper to the flour, minced garlic to the onions and mushrooms and more ground salt and pepper to the entire dish once all the ingredients were added to the pan. When I make this again I think I will use more onion and definitely more spices. I would add onion and garlic powder and possibly some crushed red pepper to the sauce.

I love the creamy white wine based of the Piccata Sauce. It's buttery with slight taste of lemon juice. Just the way I like it!

R. Winn
Perfect, but I added capers because I’m used to them in picatta

Came together fairly quickly for a weeknight dinner. It's a nice recipe that could easily be served for a special occasion also. I wanted a strong lemon flavor so I added zest to the sauce mixture. I cooked the chicken and moved to the oven to keep warm. Did the same with the mushrooms/onions and I added garlic, then made/reduced the sauce. Assembled on the plate...linguine, chicken, vegetables and sauce. I didn't want the breading on the chicken to get soggy and I wanted to control the amount of sauce. Very good!
Perfect
I’m a huge chicken piccata fan. This recipe was simple and delicious. The addition of mushrooms and onions was a great add to my old recipe. I will make this again!

I cook the onions first because it takes so long and then add the mushrooms. All this is separate from my pan of chicken. I added a lot to the flour because I don't think salt and paprika would add enough flavor. I included Italian spices, pepper, garlic, and parsley and I think it is a great addition. When I tasted the sauce alone, it seems too lemony. But when eaten with the chicken, mushrooms and onions the flavors are great.
Delish!
Excellent recipe. Just add capers to it as well and some minced garlic and a little heavy whipping cream.

To truly make this recipe 5 stars it needs garlic and capers (which I added). The chicken was delicious and moist. This is the way I will make piccata from now on. It can easily be changed to Chicken Marsala by substituting Marsala wine for the white wine and 1-2 tablespoons of tomato paste for the capers. Will definitely make this again.
Love it
I followed the recipe as written and it’s a keeper! I served it with rice and a green salad. Perfect meal, easy, tasty and comforting. Will definitely be making this again.
My husband and I made this tonight, we rated this dish a keeper. Quick, easy & delicious.
I made it with elbows pasta cut down for two portions an used the leftover all purpose flour in place of cornstarch. Good stuff.
I love this recipe. easy to make.
Delicious!! Thanks for the recipe!
Yum! Easy! Just layer! I used taco seasoning instead of cayenne.

I've made this a few times, My husband I I love it. I have also breaded portobello mushroom and that is delicious as well. 
So good!!
I made homemade this delicious dinner! I did not change a thing. This will always be a go to midweek dinner!

Very good! Just made a few small changes to recipe: I pounded the chicken to 1/2 inch and after sautéing the chicken removed it from pan to sauté mushrooms and onions then added chicken back to pan. Also added capers after adding wine/lemon liquid to pan. Excellent recipe, chicken is flavorful and moist.
I followed the recipe but I doubled the sauce. Also added a few tablespoons of capers.Better than a restaurant! Served over linguine. Will make for company next time!

Great recipe! I cut the chicken into thinner & smaller strips, skipped the egg/milk station, added garlic powder and ground pepper to the flour mixture, removed pan-fried chicken to a plate, deglazed with some wine, then added olive oil and sautéed onions and minced garlic and mushrooms with salt and pepper until mushroom has dehydrated quite a bit, then added more wine and a slurry of chicken broth + lemon juice + remaining breading flour mixture + a tiny bit of corn starch. I served the chicken with the sauce on the side, over brown rice and a salad with white-wine vinaigrette. Everyone enjoyed it.

I love this recipe. I had to add a 1/2 cup more of broth and 1/4 more wine and a little bit of minced garlic to cut the lemon taste. I only wanted a hint of lemon. I prefer it that way. Plus, that helped stretch the sauce some as well. I also pounded the chicken. I was surprised that this recipe didn't call for that. Also, a restaurant that I frequent puts red peppers on it so I did the same. It was great.

I have made many versions of Piccata over the years and was pleasantly surprised with this one. I like the idea of combining the lemon juice, broth wine and cornstarch in a bowl first. I also like the milk and egg before the flour better than just flour. The only thing I added which was not in this recipe were capers. I have never seen Piccata without them. I sauteed 2TBS of them along with the onions, mushrooms and extra garlic removed from pan then fried the chicken. Delish!!! This is my new go to piccata. Will try it with veal sometime.

I used ten thin chicken cutlets so I increased all the ingredients. Didn’t use lemon juice because I didn’t have it and didn’t need cornstarch because sauce thickened nicely on its own from the flour used on the chicken. Very good! We all really liked it. Served with egg noodles.
Didn't have any mushrooms, it turned out great! I tenderized the slices of chicken as well which wasn't mentioned here. Would make it again!
Loved this recipe! Step 3 made this very moist and tender chicken.
Very easy to make. Turned out well, delicious. May add capers next time.
I think the flavour is just not to my liking, personally
Kids and I loved it! I added brocoli but that took up too much of the sauce so I'll make more sauce next time. I put the brocoli in towards the end, cooked it for maybe 10 minutes.
This recipe is the bomb. I used thin sliced chicken breasts and followed the exact instructions. We ate it all!
I love mushrooms, but they did not enhance the recipe. I added capers, and that helped. A little bland.

I made this dish with both boneless, skinless chicken thighs and thin-sliced chicken breasts, cooked separately in unsalted butter and kept warm in a 350° oven while I made the sauce. I only had Sauvignon blanc, so I used that, and it gave the dish amazing flavor. I reduced the sauce for about 15 minutes before putting only the chicken thighs back in the pan, because they required more cooking time. I simmered it for another 10-12 minutes before spooning the sauce over the chicken from the oven and served it all over pasta that was seasoned with butter, pink salt and pepper. My husband had three helpings, and had nothing but good things to say about this recipe. I think it's fantastic and it will be a regular dinner option in our house from now on. I'll be experimenting with serving it over rice pilaf, on a bed of cooked spinach, etc. Lots of possibilities with this fabulous dish!
Very tasty, I doubled the spices for the coating. I added more mushroom and onion; tossed in some capers as well. Everyone loved it. Total do again!
Awesome easy recipe!!

Great basic recipe! A couple small changes I have made are removing the chicken after browning and then adding a clove of garlic (minced) when I added the mushrooms and onion to the skillet. Once you saute the veggies, add the liquid, stir to mix well and place the chicken back in the skillet to simmer.
Great recipe, and I put in the capers. Now it’s Piccata.
My husband and grandson loved it. I served it over a bed of spaghetti with a side of green salad. I love that it was easy to make and is low calorie! I’ll definitely make this again.
Fine tasting but I would like to see the sauce just a bit thicker.
Usually I’m a tough sell on a lot of recipes but this was perfect! Super easy to make and fast. Don’t add or skip anything. I served it with pasta.

I followed other reviewers and removed the chicken from the pan before making the sauce. I added 2 cloves of garlic to the onion and I seasoned the chicken breasts before sauteing them. I also doubled the sauce and made with thin spaghetti. With those changes everyone really enjoyed this dinner - I will definitely make it again.
Family favorite! I make this all the time.

Made it tonight using suggestions to double the sauce, add garlic and not cook the chicken in the sauce. Chicken was cooked perfectly but sauce was quite bland. It needs to be richer. I sauteed it down to a very thick consistency but I wont be making this again. If you decide to make it, test it with family before friends.
well, i didn't have any of the white wines they called for, but i did have Reisling and it over powered the sauce, won't make it again with wine, i will find some other substitute

So delicious! I partially cooked the chicken removed from the pan After the mushrooms and onions were sauteed, I returned the chicken for the remainder of the cooking time. Also added minced garlic. Had with spaghetti with butter, oil and garlic, and a glass of wine, of course!

I made this with angel hair pasta and my wife and I loved it. It's delicate yet tasty! Next time I make it, I'll double up on the mushrooms and triple the onions to add more flavor and sustenance to the recipe. Overall though, it's great!

Made this for guests. It was a hit. I too added capers, doubled the sauce recipe and removed the chicken before making the sauce. I also seasoned the chicken with some salt and pepper beforehand. Served it wish roasted vegetables and rice. Amazing.

Delicious! Cooked chicken (tenderloins) first, then removed from pan and kept warm (as other reviewers suggested). Sauteed mushrooms, onions and garlic until tender. Added sauce and simmered 20 minutes, then added chicken back into the pan for the last 3-4 minutes. It was tender and tasty. Next time, I will increase the sauce. Thanks for the recipe.
I made this for a weekend dinner while we packed for a move. It was amazing. My family loved it. I save the leftover meat and juice to make vegetable soup.

This was a hit at my house! I did make a few adjustments—I pounded the large chicken breasts & also cut them in half, so they would be more tender. I also increased the sauce ingredients so there would be more sauce in the end, and I cooked the mushrooms and onions separately before spooning them over the cooked chicken and then baking it at 350 for about twenty minutes. Delicious! Served this over homemade risotto, which was perfect for soaking up the sauce. Fresh green beans rounded out our meal.
Very tasty dish, a little bit of work, but totally worth the effort!

I made this exactly according to the instructions but didn't use the egg dip. It is superb! I added 2 TLB of H&H instead of the cornstarch bc we like "creamy" sauces. The H&H is really not needed however. This is an outstanding dish and my husband doesn't even like capers but eats them in this dish. You will love it and this recipe is the BEST!
My wife loved it. I made a few variations by adding a little more smoked paprika, lemon zest and capers. Very flavorful. Left overs today!!! :-)

It gets a five star as my kids and husband loved the addition of the mushrooms. I don’t usually change the recipes here but in this case I had some heavy / double cream that was just lying around so I used it as a mix with the broth. Turned out quite nice. We omitted the wine since I was worried about the taste for the kids - turns out this was the first time they’ve asked me for seconds in a while. I had to make a second batch of sauce.
need to make sure and get the corn starch thoroughly mixed in to thicken up the cause, glover was excellent, next time will add some capers!

Extremely easy, tasted delicious!
Will make this again .......

It was very good, but in my opinion lacked some flavor. I might add a bit more salt to the dredge and a bit to the sauce. But otherwise it was delicious! I served it over fettuccini and my husband loved it.
super, 5 stars.
Excellent. 5 star restaurant quality.
I made it exactly as written, but excluded the salt and used Mrs. Dash Lemon Pepper. It was great...
We have made this recipe many time and it never disappoints!!!!

This is a great recipe! I used chicken tenders instead of breasts and also added a tablespoon of capers, then served it over linguine. It is simple to make for week night meals, & special enough to make for company. Delicious!
The addition of an arugula salad with sliced onion, tomatoes, tuscan-balsamic vinegar & olive oil made for a nice meal.

A delicious variation of chicken piccata. I made it with no changes except I used boneless skinless chicken thighs. It was a big hit in my family. It had lots of sauce. Served it with linguini and roasted broccoli. Definitely a keeper.
Love this receipt. My kids and I add a small amount of goat cheese or feta on top of the chicken while it’s hot and cover with mushroom sauce. It’s a regular in our dinner rotation.

I had baked chicken thighs to use somehow and choose this recipe. I sauteed a one slice of diced onions in butter, added 1 teaspoon of minced garlic and a sprinkle of paprika. I sliced the chicken off the bone, used five and added to skillet. I poured enough chardonnay in to cover the bottom of the skillet and allowed time to heat through. I sliced mushrooms and decided to add artichoke hearts to the recipe. How many you use depends on how much meat you use. This recipe is easy to adjust to the number of people eating. I added more wine for making enough gravy to coat all. When the mushrooms were tender, I thickened the sauce with a tablespoon of flour mixed into cold water, added another sprinkle of paprika and salt. When the sauce was thickened, I stirred to coat all with the gravy and sprinkled 1/3 cup fresh parsley over all. Any dish made in a wine sauce makes for a very special meal at my house.

My entire family loved this with these changes: I did not coat the chicken with the flour, egg, and milk. I cut the chicken into thick strips and sprinkled the pieces with salt and paprika then sauteed it with the butter, onions, and mushrooms. I also added more cornstarch for thickening since I didn't coat the chicken with flour.
Delicious!!!!!
De-lish! Didn't change anything except adding a few capers. Will definitely make again.

Over all very good. I didn't have white wine on hand so I subbed ACV, which was totally fine and acceptable for taste. I think the corn starch thickened it a bit too much so I will use less next time. I served over GF spaghetti because I didn't have angel hair on hand, which is my favorite pasta to pair with this recipe.

I cubed the chicken and flattened the chicken before coating in a mix of flour, paprika, pepper and some lemon zest then pan cooking in the oil. For the sauce I used equal parts broth and wine to one-half part lemon juice, which gives it a nice lemony taste without the tartness. Also substitute artichoke hearts instead of the onion. One of my wife's favorite dishes (yes, I cook and clean up).
Excellent! I added some capers and served it over noodles.
Very easy and tasty recipe. I will be making this again.

Very good. I browned the chicken, removed it, sauteed the mushrooms and onion, then replaced the chicken and poured the sauce on top. Perfect. I cut the salt in half as that is what I always do but for this recipe I would keep at 1 tsp especially since all the breading does not get used. I used 4 half breasts and cut each in half so had 8 pieces (about 2.25 lbs of chicken). Agreed, a little bland - needs something to perk up.

I made this last night and it was excellent. I read almost all the reviews first to get a feel for what alterations may be needed. I did not have white wine so I used more of the broth. I actually did not use broth. I used fat free cream of chicken soup with water added. I always substitute Cream of chicken for chicken broth in anything I make. I think it adds flavor. I did take the chicken out of the pan while I put the sauce and mushrooms together like others stated. We will be having this again!
I used Toasted Head Chardonnay & Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice and this came out amazing!

It turned out really well. I added about a cup extra chicken broth and about a half cup more wine and an extra tablespoon of cornstarch so I could mix angel hair noodles in with the sauce. I also still added in the capers while everything was simmering together.
My husband loved this dish. Along with the great taste it was easy to make.
Wife and I loved it, set on long grain rice.
Used 1 breast but kept the rest of the ingredients the same, next time I will reduce the amount of butter.
Made it and it turned out SO GOOD! Highly recommend

This turned very well. However, I may cut back on the amount of butter. The recipe calls for 4 tablespoons. The butter taste was a little overwhelming. I'm thinking of trying 2 tbsp of butter and 2 of olive oil or canola oil.
Very good but I would double the sauce

I made it exactly as the recipe reads.
My side dish was orzo.
Used thighs & had basil leaves from garden to use instead of parsley & 4 instead of 1 garlic cloves.
Did not make any changes except for a few more chopped onions. Dish was excellent!
My husband and I both loved it! Can’t wait to make it again!
Yummy!!

Turned out wonderful, chicken was moist I did boneless breasts and non boneless thighs and they cooked fine using the same time. Did not make any changes to the recipe. Will definitely make this again.
This was simply delicious! I served it with buttered noodles, but rice would have been a better choice.
Outstanding. Moist chicken and the most flavorful mushroom, lemon, wine and butter sauce. Loved it! Pretty easy though you must pay attention. Cast iron made it I think.
Definitely caries out for capers. Also I would mix corn starch with T. of col water and add separately, not with other wet ingredients as noted.
Loved it but I added capers and it made it even better!

I made this according to recipe and it was delicious! Lots of compliments from my daughter & son in law. I did slice my chicken breast in half lengthwise to get thinner pieces and then used a tenderizer mallet to give them uniform thickness. I browned the chicken first in butter & avocado oil, and removed it to a plate to keep warm while I sautéed the onions & mushrooms and then added the rest of the sauce ingredients. Put the chicken in the sauce for a couple minutes & served it. Delicious!

I used skinless chicken thighs. I also used clarified butter for frying which allowed me to fry the chicken at a higher temperature. It really helped to get the chicken nicely browned. Served over jasmine rice. I would definitely make this again.
